channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024070571
item.description:
Report E-2024070571

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately half a gallon (.5) of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a puncture from a sharp object. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized the recovered material, PPE and the damaged drum in to one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071347
item.description:
Report X-2024071347

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE. INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FROZEN PET FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED SNUGGLEME RAW, PERISHABLE, FREEZE UPON ARRIVAL AND KEEP UPRIGHT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO THE WEST PRIMARY TO A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. PACKAGE AND RELATED MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF PACKAGE, THE LIQUID MATERIAL WAS SOLIDIFIED AND NEUTRALIZED AND PROCESSED THORUGH ETT.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 5-gallons of "320 Cleaner" UN1993 were released from a 5-gallon DM due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they feel comfortable that terminal personnel can clean the release with PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024070462
item.description:
Report E-2024070462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) additional 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024071164

item.title: Report E-2024070418
item.description:
Report E-2024070418

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that an unknown quantity of Delta-Therm AE 7102 Isocyanate was released from (1) 3400-pound steel tank due to improper loading (the strap was not placed correctly and caused the valve to open). The release impacted the inside of the trailer. The tank was not damaged and they were able to get the valve closed and stopped releasing. No waste will be generated. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
